metadata.title: CVE-2022-42896 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - high
metadata.description:
There are use-after-free vulnerabilities in the Linux kernel'snet/bluetooth/l2cap_core.c's l2cap_connect and l2cap_le_connect_reqfunctions which may allow code execution and leaking kernel memory(respectively) remotely via Bluetooth. A remote attacker could execute codeleaking kernel memory via Bluetooth if within proximity of the victim. Werecommend upgrading past commit https://www.google.com/urlhttps://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/711f8c3fb3db61897080468586b970c87c61d9e4https://www.google.com/url

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42896` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required
